channel.title: Back to Basics
channel.description: [center][img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/9098208/backtobasicsspreadsheet.png[/img] [b]Information[/b] Revision: 317 Base: Hyperion Client: 317 deob 333 cache (no edits) [b]Developers[/b] Canownueasy Rene eatz waffles Want to join in? Apply! [code]Alias: Age: Experience: Example of your code:[/code] Hello everybody! It's me Canownueasy and Rene here! We're working hard to redevelop the server in a very efficient and smooth manner. [b]Tech[/b] [i]For all you computer-interested folks out there![/i] [u]Attributes[/u] Our attributes system was made to prevent unorganized variables clogging up entity-extension objects. It's fast, reliable, and easy to use! Our first type of attributes system can replace boolean variables. It's an attribute tag system that is constructed with an array list-iteration of a String. We can easily add/remove temporary attributes that store data with the more advanced attributes system. This system can replace int(integer) variables. Constructed with a hash map-interaction of String for the attribute key, and Integer for the attribute value it's a simple solution to storing data that we can serialize to a player's game file. These attributes save thousands of pages in memory and used the right way lead to a more organized server! [u]Plugins[/u] We have setup many plugin systems all around the server. From teleportation plugins, to projectile based spell plugins, the plugins are simple abstract classes that serve as interfaces for a true-plugin. A true-plugin has pre-made data and few construction arguments making content-development far more elegant. The plugin system is based around the OOP (object-oriented programming) style, where there are many branches off other objects. [b]Combat[/b] The combat's a beast, and it's only 5% finished. Max hit formula & accuracy is almost perfect. [b]Game Dev[/b] [i]If you like game development media, check this out![/i] Start of Combat [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/combatpre.gif[/img] Combat with specials [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/preview-specials.gif[/img] Mage/Range combo [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/magerangecombo.gif[/img] Melee/Range combo [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/BOOM.gif[/img] [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/rangecombo.gif[/img] Mage/Melee hybrid combo [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/magemeleecombo.gif[/img] Ladders [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/proladders.gif[/img] [img]http://www.devianx.com/pictures/1.png[/img] [img]http://www.devianx.com/pictures/2.png[/img] [img]http://www.devianx.com/pictures/3.png[/img] [img]http://www.devianx.com/pictures/4.png[/img] [img]http://www.devianx.com/pictures/5.png[/img] [b]Web Dev[/b] [i]Like classy web development? This section's for you![/i] [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/controlcentre-home.png[/img] [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/controlcentre-manage.png[/img] [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/controlcentre-login.png[/img] [b]Quotes[/b] [i]What are others saying?[/i] : "Far better programmed than any server I've seen in a LONG time." : "noice"

why not use a system in which developers make content as complex as they want while users install a simple plugin

Way to go, you buy servers from Scull, you steal ideas from Blakeman, and you shit code with Rene.

No offence, but this will be worse than WinterLove.

If you want to provide constructive criticism go ahead.

why not use a system in which developers make content as complex as they want while users install a simple plugin

Way to go, you buy servers from Scull, you steal ideas from Blakeman, and you shit code with Rene.

No offence, but this will be worse than WinterLove.[/quote]Do you not read details? Nobody likes put-downs.

If you want to provide constructive criticism go ahead.

And Graham says this is far better programmed then any server he’s seen in a long time so you’re very wrong.

I talked to him on MSN about it, and he says everything is programmed properly except for new instances for ‘skills’ which I have removed. Actions are handled solely without creating instances for skills now.
